newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: Five wounded in Cambodia grenade attack.
newsitem.headline: Five wounded in Cambodia grenade attack.

text.p: Five people were wounded in a grenade attack outside a Phnom Penh restaurant on Saturday, local news reports said.
The motive for the attack was not clear though it did not appear to be political, the reports said.
Phnom Penh has been tense in recent weeks due to a long-running feud between the country's two prime ministers who head a fractured coalition government.

Security men loyal to the two prime ministers fought a gun battle on the streets of Phnom Penh last week leaving two men dead. U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine Albright subsequently cancelled a trip to Cambodia because of security concerns.
Up to 19 people were killed and more than 100 wounded in a grenade attack on an opposition rally in the city on March 30. No arrests have been made in connection with that attack.
